text: William Earl Casper, Jr. (June 24, 1931 â€“ February 7, 2015) was an American professional golfer. He was one of the most prolific tournament winners on the PGA Tour from the mid-1950s to the mid-1970s. Casper died at his home in Springville, Utah on February 7, 2015 after having pneumonia and a heart attack, aged 83. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1931 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American golfers Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Disease-related deaths in Utah Category:Sportspeople from San Diego
title: Billy Casper
